snippet: The Commodity Futures Trading Commission is preparing to appeal a recent court ruling that struck down new curbs on Wall Street trading. But the appeals court, which is dominated by Republican appointed judges, may also object to the so-called...
abstract: The Commodity Futures Trading Commission is preparing to appeal a recent court ruling that struck down new curbs on Wall Street trading. But the appeals court, which is dominated by Republican appointed judges, may also object to the so-called position limits rule.

headline.main: Regulator Prepares to Appeal Dodd-Frank Court Ruling
